values:
According to livejournal I haven't posted in 61 weeks. I really thought there were much more, but bleh. It's not like I feel like using this account like before, not because I dislike it or anything but just I lost the track. 

BUT! I think my livejournal friends (if someone still remembers me here, hehe) deserve to know a little sad news from this southern part of the world. Anybody here remembers Lalo Pirincho? Little hedgehog of love and anger? Well, Lalo, my little Lalo is very sick. Since December, last year, he has cancer. It started in his mouth, he couldn't eat because his food was too hard for him to chew on (so now I give it to him 
dampened on water). The doctor said it was the bad type of cancer, the one that will spread on his body regardless any surgery he could do. Besides, trying to operate a little animal like him is dangerous as well, the anesthesia could be too much for him and die. So we decided to let him live as long as he were happy, eating and grunting. 

I could notice how his tumor was getting bigger with time and now the right side of his face is overly bulging and he can't open that eye. And now his left eye is starting to close as well. 

Now I'm in a point I don't know very well what to do: Should I end this for him? Should I let him live a little longer? Lalo is a fighter, I just *know* he wants to live, but I don't want him to suffer. He's still eating and moving, but he doesn't play as much as before. The doctor said it'll be the time when he stopped eating but I'm not sure. I bet he's going to eat until his last breath because he's that strong. 

I wish you could tell me how you feel, Lalín.

I'm back at college once again since last Wednesday. The very first day, in the class I failed last year, they give us a damn long assignment I've been doing since last Thursday, every evening until his moment in which I'm about to finish but absolutely drained. And when I'm this tired, I got ridiculously scared. I know it's because I'm not used to cope with failures, but really, girl, I can not believe my self.confidence got this damaged last year. Ok, ok, I never had that much self confidence, but now, in just the first assignment I can't help but to remember the times the teachers told us we obviously hadn't work hard enough when we stayed awake several nights. I'm afraid once again, long time of working won't equal success, and I have worked so much in this assignment it'll suck big time if I don't get a good mark. 

*Sigh* At least now I have a s.o. in which I can trust to cheer me up, but I don't want to get tiresome with my rants so I'll try to do it more in LJ than with him *chuckles* 

Ok, got my 5 minutes of emo teenager, which I do not like nor want to be, now I can carry on my life.

Yesterday I lived my first real medical emergency ever. At 7am my dad came to my room telling me my mom didn't feel well and to dress her up to take her to the hospital. That night I went to bed at 4am but hearing my mom was feeling unwell woke me up inmediately. But what I saw when I entered to her room shocked me: She was lying still, arms and legs spreaded, eyes wide open just staring the ceiling, barely breathing as I checked because she wasn't looking really alive. She was suffering a really severe allergic reaction, she couldn't move or talk. While dad insisted in dressing her and looked called an ambulance, I miserably failed to lift her upper body to do so and complaining the last thing the doctors will worry about was to see her in her pyjamas.

It was impossible get an ambulance to take her to a private hospital, so we had to call one for a public one, really desperate measures since it was impossible for us to carry her down the five floors of the apartment (is and old one so doesn't have lift) All in while, we followed the instructions of the ambulance operator and put her on floor in foetal position so she could breath more easily. Now that I think back in that moment, I was too calm, as I my mom scolded me today. Apparently having 20 years and not freaking out in a emergency isn't normal, but really it was because my dad was very calm too and my grandpa was freaked out, while my two little sisters slept. While we waited for the ambulance I stayed by my mom telling her to be ok and calm, when she lifted her arm, grabbed my hand and weakly told me she was going to be alright, a picture still haunts me because it touched me so much that she tried to calm me down in her state.

The paramedics arrived, checked her and told us she was going to be alright. I stayed at home calming my grandpa while my dad when to the hospital with her. A few minutes later he called me, told she was better now, talking and moving, the allergy was subsiding and she wanted shoes and clothes, so I walked to the hospital. Then it began.

I arrived the hospital at 8:30am, and in three hours, no one told us if my mom was better or had something else wrong. It was an agonizing wait, watching families crying over a dead beloved one, people faint of the pain while waiting for a doctor, old ladies complaining about the public health system in a dirty waiting room with flies and filthy dumps. After that, we had to ask about her, instead of a doctor telling us she was alright, just waiting for the drug to act on her body. That broke me down on tears, all the anguish banishing only leaving relief and tears. After that, I was beginning to feel the 4 hours of sleep in my body, so we wanted to take mom back home quickly so we could eat and sleep.

At 1:30pm something shameful happened; Mom was well since 10, 10!! but no one told us until we asked at 11:30, and she was release, without a real diagnosis, when a doctor told her just to go home, without calling us so we can give her her clothes and shoes or help her. She wasn't wearing her glasses, so couldn't find the exit. A nurse just pointed some random spot on the corridor, and she finally appeared on the main entrance of the hospital, wrapped on the woolen blanket the paramedic used to cover her body when taking her out of the house, barefoot and looking tired. The first thing I thought was she was on drugs and had ran away from those idiotic doctors, but she told us the truth. She also had some nasty marks on her arm where the nurses tried to inject her the drugs. Really, the public health system is a royal piece of shit.

It was terrifying, exhausting and maddening. I thought I saw my mom dead, I was in eternal joy when I saw her alive, I felt overwhelmed because of the atrocities of the health system. We still don't know what caused this allergic reaction, we believe it was partially the huge stress she was feeling the last days. so we hope she can finally relax in this trip we're making, starting tomorrow, to the south. Our first stop is hot springs where she can enjoy the water, massages and spa, so yeah, I believe this will help us all.

Today dad sent us the itinerary for the trip we're doing in February *snickers* Sometimes I love him for being organized, sometimes he goes over the top. This time he included places, routes and hours, so yeah, it made me laugh a little. We're going to the south and originally pretended to go to Bariloche, in Argentina as well, but we couldn't find a hotel to reserve, so it's still unsure if we go or not. A real disappointment, considering the chocolates from Bariloche are the best I've tried, obscenely cheap and highly addictive. Anyway, we're going to the hot springs, maybe do some rafting and/or canopy, so yeah, no complains from me. 

The salsa lessons are the best f*cking thin I've done. I know it'll be hard, but I want to do it all the year, not just in summer break. It was about bloody time I started acting like a latin girl and learn how to move my hips *laughs* The class is great, the guys are all nice and funny, and the teachers are funny and playful. They were talking about taking the class to a salsa club, though we still know basic steps, but anyway I looooove this.

I'll be officially taking salsa lessons. I'm so glad I could make it :D I really needed some excuse to stop playing World of Warcraft so much, and between singing and salsa lessons, I took the second one. *sighs* That's what I told my friends when they showed me the game: "I don't like this stuff, I know I'll get addicted and then what?! I'll be playing like a maniac!"... And that happened xD so here I am, learning some self control and dancing on the evenings.

My fellows LJ posters, I must admit this Xmas I was a lazy ass. Not just because I was depressed the firsts weeks because of my failure at school, or just because my savings are in pain due school, but also because I wasn't feeling in the mood for presents or cards. But fear not, I already had presents in mind for you, I just want to survive this Xmas and in January I'll be sending your presents. I may have asked for your address to some of you. If you hadn't reply, I may ask again and then, if I don't get an answer, I'll understand and won't bother you asking again ^^U. 

Lets enjoy the holiday with our families and beloved ones!

I haven't officially finished this semester, this Monday I've got my last exam, economics, and then I'll be free for good. Last Wednesday had the final exam of my main course, the one that causes some of the angsty emo-teenager entries in the previous weeks. Every minute working on my last assignment, an upgrade for a men wallet, went from bad to dreadful. This must be the project we had to start all over again more times, and never the teachers quite liked it. I ended crying my heart out one evening over my mom shoulders, feeling, for the first time in my life, the inevitable failure in one project. On school I never, ever, had to live something like that; every test was easy, always had good grades. Then, once on college, my career offered a nice challenge for a change.

So last Wednesday, with a few hours of sleep and no food, my team and I worked on a nice final dissertation, waited seven hours to show it (the organization of the final exam was frankly shameful) and the committee, against all forecast, liked us. Or something like that. They had some serious critics against the project, like they had with all the previous groups, but also understood the complications of the assignment and were actually very sympathetic with us.

Now I only can wait for the final result. I need a medium good grade, one we never got on this project. If not, well, I'll fail on this and have to do it all over again without my friends. Hard as it is, I'm actually ready to accept whatever comes because I've thought in all the possibilities and I'm tired of forecasting.

***Now lets forget that rant and let me ask you a little question. Now I'm free from college, I'm about to jump in my vice of World of Warcraft, only this time on Blizzard, the official and paid server. I'm not very sure about giving my credit card number to them so I'd like to pay for it via Paypal. Any of you knows this is a secure system for real or it's just a screen for a huge swindle? Thanks in advance :D***

Never thought this semester will be so hard; there are always hard but this one was... too much. Now, when I'm almost done with all my courses, I can't believe I'm about to fail in the one I wanted to pass the most. So yeah, I haven't overcame the emo moment at all. So now I'm just hoping a miracle will happen and I'll pass this class. I know I'm not making so much sense now, I'm tired of being centred and collected in class when having an inner turmoil. I promise, this finish on December 10 and then I won't say a word about it again, either I pass or not this damn class. Now, just for this minute I want to feel bad about myself, in a couple of hours I'll be collected yet again.

It's been such a long month. The year is almost over and in less than a month I'll be finally free but really, I wish December'd come faster. I'm pretty well in almost all my courses except in one which is giving me a hard time. Anyway, I'm not going to bore with my college stuff. Just wanted to show you a little something I finished just today.




A vector version of one of the alliance mounts in wow. This was mine (well, not exactly, I had the purple version) and since this month I'm not playing wow and then I'll be on the other faction, I'll miss my beautiful big elephant and running around on his huge back. My guildmistress think they're scary. I call them adorable :3. There is a bigger version here on which got some nice feedback in there, I'm stunned since I still think it looks, well, funny. Like made of rubber or something >_>U (not that I don't like, because I DO)

As a continuation of yesterday's post
... and finally, finally, after a 3 hours long no-stop brainstorm, we passed. Now if you excuse me, I have a bed waiting for me.

Ok
I worked
I falied

I worried
I worked again
I failed again

I cried and finally working again and hopping to pass this class. God, if I don't aprove this course I'm going to be so depressed =_= Being the main assignment in design, I may even consider changing to another degree. I HATE feeling this helpless.

<font size="1">I can't help but to think, if I'm going to assist Yaoi-Con next year I'll be... at least on looks, one of the younger one T_T. Seriously, traveling alone hoping they won't send me back home for being a <strike>dirty</strike> latin is bad enough, leave alone having this baby face I happen to have. </font>Ah, screw that, I REALLY want to assist next year and hoepfully meet some people there :'D. Any latin cares to join me? I think I'll need somebody who I can speak Spanish with sometimes xD.

Yay!!! I'm sooo happy. Finally, after a year and a half of being unemployed, today my mom found a job! She'll be starting this very Monday. The last months my mom had been really down, feeling like she couldn't get a job at all, which unleashed bad times where she thought she was getting too old. She was getting bored at home, so she started doing yoga twice a week to keep herself entertained. Now she'll be working, earning her own money and still doing yoga ^^. On the top of all, she's also doing something new from all her previous works: After beng secretary, assistant and hotel manager, now she'll be a supervisor. I love this woman, always improving herself. Like I said, I'm very happy for her ^^.

Yesterday my Internet connection just died. OMG died when I'm just starting to enjoy my 10-day Wow trial!!! Panicked, after coming back from college I called the company and after a few minutes of persuasion, I managed to make them bring me a technician in an hour. After checking every possible cable and connection, messing with EVERYTHING in my bedroom, his diagnosis was something like this:

"This connection is too old so bla bla bla pay this, you'll have to call the company after you buy this thing and then bla bla pay that, change every cable bla bla costs money and money, then call another guy bla bla bla install new thing that costs money and money, then call another guy who'll check everything and that costs money and money. Do you want me to call the new technician for you so you can start wasting money right away?"

So yeah, it was a not-nice amount of money we'll have to give the company or a few new wires. Guy leaves, and after 20 minutes... INTERNET IS BACK ON ITS OWN! And it hasn't gone since then. So yeah, we're lucky people here *roll eyes*

***

Thanks to that, though, today I decided to clean deeply my bedroom. It was one of those strange urges to clean I have once in every 4 months or so, but now my place looks tidy and nice, which is hard consdeiring I'm studying desing, so there are always old assignmets, used stuff, tools and dirt all around.

Of course, I also found some nice stuff. Old letters, a long lost pen, some high school things, including a comic I made on my last year about mysefl :'D It made me feel so melancholy and, at the same time, glad to be on college already as well xD. I never intended to be a draughtswoman, but I liked what I made back then :'D (maybe because for my nostalgic mood). It was about a vulpix girl (me :B) on her Monday, burning everything that bothered her xD. Yeah, now you now why I do NOT write.

It was August since I write in here last time *gasps* I better put everyting that was going on in my life in order so you can actually understand what I'm writting ^^.

I'm actually in this part of the year when I don't notice how fast time goes by, when assignments keep coming and going, and miraculously the year is over and I'll be free to enjoy my Summer. But for now, I'm glad I've reached this point in complete sanity; the last main assignment was, finally, successful, though all the anguish it brought ^^'. All for a damn lamp made with aluminium, acrylics and leds. The grade, that I don't know yet, but for me was a victory to finish it.



---------------------------
Remember I've been playing World of Warcraft like a maniac? Well, I'm still on that, whenever I have time and energy. My guild ingame is such a blast, I really like all the guys I play with. And it's better when you get to meet IRL with them. I met with them twice in this time, and loved them both. Since I came to LJ I was missing to meet with people from here. Don't get me wrong, I love to meet people from all over the globe, but it's almost impossible for me to meet IRL with ffpanda or nolan_ash. (unless we meet on yaoi-con next year :3) This is the oficial picture I took from the first meeting (and I couldn't take a picture from the second one v,v) I'm Aliosha, the human Paladin behind the camera :3.



---------------------------
The sour part of this. My uncle, my long lost uncle to alcohol and drugs came to our lives. He's one of my mom younger brothers, but he never was close to us since he had a deep problem with alcohol. He started coming home asking for money and a bed to sleep since the rest of the family is tired of bear with him. I don't have troubles helping him, but I hate to see my mom so worked up. Finally, after several talks with him, my mom managed to put him on rehabilitation (yet again). His story is sad, after all. He had everything, education, a home, a family, money and love, and lost everything due his addiction. Before having him sleeping on the streets, we rather have him in a rehabilitation centre. I really hope he can find some help there.

---------------------------
And finally, but no less important. Like every year, around September and October, Milu the sheep-dog becomes Milu the leprous-dog xD. Sadly, my camera has no battery left so I can't post a picture of my hairless lady yet.

One year ago, I asked Seba (a picture of him can be found on this post), a friend from college, a yaoi drawing as my B-day present, since I really adore how he draws. A year passed, I never saw my drawing, even though this guy promised me a second drawing for the delay. But a few days ago he finished it for me <3.

Seba- I got your drawing Tere-tere Me- O RLY? I wanna see it! *see drawing* OMG, it's SO GAY! I love it!!! S- My fingers were trembling while I drew it, my eyes almost melt, but I managed to finish it just for you. M- That's so sweet S- Even worst, you see I covered any private part, but I KNEW perfectly what was under their legs! and it was terrible! He's so nice =^^=. I love it especially since this is more like my current yaoi liking. When I just got started with yaoi, I liked girly ukes and manly semes, but right now I'm more fond of switchers and/or manly couples. Now I hope my second drawing don't take another year to be ready xD. God, I can't stop watching it <333, I'll try to find a way to colour it ^^.

Ok, that was it, my winter break is over and now I'm getting ready to go back to school tomorrow *sobs*. It was such a good time to stay at home or hanging out with friends. I saw a lot of friends I neglected during the semester, and the ones I wasn't able to see make me promise we'll meet at the next anime convenction, who knows, maybe I'll cosplay or sing at the karaoke event, it would be nice. I went to the cinema a lot, got my tummy sick for a couple of days, well, a good time ^^.

Also, was the perfect time to release my addiction to World of Warcraft (WoW). I never, ever played a MMORPG, because I know I get addicted to those games from hell veeeery easily. Never played Ragnarok, Ultima, Lineage or anything like that! But nooo, my dear friends from college played it and they wanted me to play too! So I ended playing on the alliance side (the good ones, kinda).

It's a very very good game, great graphics and playability, so anyone who may be interested, and doesn't want to pay for the real game in blizzard, I can give you the game and all play in one, a pirate server which crashes and has a lot of bugs but is for free :D. Come and play in the azeroth realm!

And because I want, all my girls! <3



Aliosha, level 42, is a human paladin (a warrior/mage mixed class)



Seiren, level 12, a night elf druid (can shapesft into animals and trees)



Lieses, level 10, a draenei hunter (can have pets which fight by them side)



Aliosha in her purple elephant, an Elekk



Elekk again, because I love it <3



And another mount of Aliosha, a warhorse, but I don't use it because it's ugly xD

For the Alliance! death to the horde :D

Now would you please wish me luck for my next semester? especially because I'm planning to work while studying, in order to earn some money for Yaoi-con next year :D

My dear friends, after presenting our last assignment, a formal exam about a store we designed. It was last Wednesday but I couldn't find the camera cable before :D. That day, we finished the semester, with good grades, by the way! We worked the whole semester together, in several courses, and I couldn't be happier with them, they even came to my house last Saturday for my birthday and sang karaoke as usual when we try to work xD.



Seba and Felipe, my two guys <3. I'll go insane without them when the assignments are too overwhelming.



Felipe and his famous pose xD.



Me and Vero in a pose she said was like a cosplay picture. And she knows about it since she has cosplayed since 2002. I luv her too <3



The whole group :D and a lot of extra stuff around us xD.

You know? I'm not a teen anymore... which scares me and fills me with joy at the same time xD (and, of course, it's a good excuse to ask my parents expensive drinks xD OMG, this year I've become addicted to vodka, especially Vanilla Vodka). 

I officialy declare from today until October next year I'll save money so I can go to Yaoi-con! <3

- So you read Naruto since long ago?
- Yeah, like... I dun know, 4 years? 
- Wow, that's a lot! And which is your favorite pairing?
- My love always goes for Naruto and Hinata, I love-love-love them together
- ....
- What?
- But you said you liked yaoi, right?
- ...Yes, so?
- I don't know, I expected you to like SasuxNaru like everybody else
- I hate that pairing, I hate Sasuke D: Sasuke should die soooon~
- Or GaaraxNaruto then, KakaIru, JiraiyaxNaruto...
- Girl, I like almost only cannon pairings, I don't really like fan pairings, too ooc for me. To put two bishies together, when they share no more than 30 minutes together, in a non-romantic scene, that's ooc. 
- But Naruto and Sasuke are so uke - seme
- You may think that, but not me
- You are the only yaoi fan girl I know that doesn't like SasuxNaru
- *rolleyes* yeah, we're really scarse. That, or maybe I just blew my fangirl fuse...

After some weeks from hell, finally, FINALLY I can breath. Thanks everybody who read my last post. Today we got my mom's exams. My biggest fear was she had a tumor but no, it's an untranslatable thing in her cartilage and something else I don't remember :D. At least she's not in pain anymore like she was before. I'm SO relieved, and in good time, since I only have two more weeks of school.

Now that I think about it, this year came with several false alarms in the health department. My grandfather and his lung thing for example, which ended being... nothing :P (one doctor told him he must have been staved on the lung when he was a kid and he doesn't remember!)

And people! We only have less than a month to crown Easter Island between the 7 new wonders! Which, oh my my, will be revealed on July 7th, my birthday, by the way ;D

If anyone could pray or just think about my mom's health, I'll be highly thankful. Since we still don't know what she has, I only need a 'general' pray if any of you is a believer or sorta. Thanks in advance!

So here is the deal I'd been discussing with my parents lately: Next year I'll be 21, one of those 'special' birthdays you know people would expect for you to throw a huge party and that shit stuff. I do, however, find it quite helpful for me. Why? Because I'm seriously planning to go to the Yaoi-con next year. Let me stress this just a little: Seriously. The plane ticket would be free thanks to my dad's job, so I'm only asking them money for stay, food and those expenses. In fact, I'm planning to work this Summer to earn some money myself. And I'll fight do all the procedures to get my visa.

I'm death serious about this. I'm already of age, I have already worked on Summers so nothing new. The language? Let say I have a whole year to practice my spoken English =D. This idea is already rooted in my head so now there is no way back, only determination to achieve this goal. Any donations will be highly appreciated not xD.

Now I have two questions for any kind lady or gentleman from the United States.

1.- Is Yaoi-con always in San Francisco, or the location changes every year?

And in other topic, very different.

2.- I need a quick description of California. Not the people, but the place. Just a few words that help me to imagine the place, pretty please!

One of the first things I learned in design was a program called 'Freehand' and something called 'vectors'. Right now I totally hate freehand, I still prefer Photoshop and Illustrator because everything is more friendly there. AND, Photoshop also work with vectors, just slightly different. Vectors are a way of drawing based on maths (what a lame definition) If you've watched Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends, the animations is vector based.

Last year I evaded learning them at any cost, but right now I'm really interested in working with them. They're clean, you can enlarge them endlessly and the completion is always beautiful (if you use them right)

My very first vector image was finished just a few minutes ago! I know I'm still very new in this but I know this is just practice, practice and practice. Based on this picture, I created a simplified, vectorized version.



I wanted to use a dancer for this. Ballet is too tired, I couldn't find good pictures of dancers with umbrellas or fans, so I chose Flamenco. I have a soft spot for it, I totally love it!

Feel free to don't understand it, don't like it and/or flame it. My mom needed like 15 minutes to understand what's so great about this ;__; and true to be told, it's mostly because is the first, not the best xD.

Your True Nature by llScorpiusll
Username

In a survival situation, you:Freak out
Your hidden talent is:Pragmatism

In groups, you:Feel uncomfortable

For being just a random meme with random answers, it's pretty assertive (especially in which quality appeals to me and my weakness!) AND I even learned a new word xD (industriouness!) But 'iron constitution'? xD that made me laugh. Badly.

Well, there actually is a candy mountain a mysterious force that wants me to be happy. This week is definitely starting like hell (have exams/assignments every single day) when I meet... this:



The video is so old I can't believe I didn't watch this before!!! Ok, ok, the subtitles are shit xD, the original version is in Spanish here. Now I pretty much need to learn this choreography and, hopefully, meet those guys in person! xDD and I'm still in love with the wiimote xD I don't hate it yet (maybe is hate us because it gets hit several times per day). Now back to study ;___;.

I knew I was going to catch a cold when I leave for college this morning with my hair wet, silly me. It's not serious but added to the severe lack of sleep, I'm feeling groggy. But I think I needed to catch a cold to be blessed with a revelation about my life. Since I started studying design last year I was happy but not completely. I like this stuff but something was missing, and I never was really sure about my *real* skills for design. I like graphic design, editorial design and typography, but again, something missing. 

The last two weeks has been so busy I had some serious thinking about this. I liked my career, but I wasn't sure about future. Then today... it came to me. Realization. Is not that I don't like design, but what blows my mind is ...
...
....

and don't laugh!

Marketing.
....

No, really. I love marketing! Even better, design in my school includes several marketing courses, so I won't need to change my career. I just have to endure this and the next semester with shitty courses and then the real fun will begin! I'm also decided to get a minor on administration and I finally have a clear goal in life. Should I feel silly for saying this? xD, because I'm starting to feel like that. Well, that's me, silly Ashley and her silly colds *goes to her bed*.

Going back to college always puts me in a very melancholy mood. I can't help it! I miss to be a lazy-ass when my workload rises out of control (not yet) I'm glad to be back, I love my new classes and I really have high expectations for this year, I've started therapy and all so yeah, I should start with some positive energy. I also love my new theology class, basically because is like a mix of literature and philosophy *happy face*.

Well, this melancholy was focused on youtube where I found lots of videos of '31 minutos', a not-so old chilean tv show for kids with puppets, socks and bowling pins xD. It was pretty lame (and I LOVED it) and, somehow, the show was bought by Nickelodeon and shown in all Latin America and Brazil (the portuguese versions of the songs are hilarious!) Obviously the video is in Spanish. Is not one of the songs but a little piece of handicraft with Patana. Learn how to create somethin cool with stuff you have in your own house!



And right now, I feel like watching the movie Machuca again.

"The New Seven Wonders of the World is a proposed revision of the Seven Wonders of the World, organized by a Swiss-based, for-profit corporation called New Open World Corporation (NOWC)." That's what wikipedia has to say to introduce you to the new7wonders. Me, on the other hand, has something else to add.

Between the 21 competitors we find... .... a chilean one! *clap clap* You sure know these ones, have seen them more than once in tv, but did you know they were chilean? I'm talking about the Easter Island Moais.




Now, let's say you go to the site New7Wonders and want to vote. You only need to give an e-mail account and you can vote for your seven favourites. With no intention of influence you, let me give you a suggestion. Why don't you vote for the Easter Island Moais? You know you want to! ;D

This campaing is a shared effor with
hakyumi
. Chilean blogger, join us!

Today I spent the day with
mishiru_shi
. It's always so nice to be with her, we met online and then became a 'real life' friend quickly after that. I brought her the to Korean Supermarket and I was sorta scared how happy a fangirl can get in any orientalish place. I took the chance to buy a new pair of pretty chopsticks and some chocolate pocky, while she bought, well, a lot of stuff xD. Congratulations, Mixy, for your first time trying ramen, sorry it was so spicy!

She brought me the most delicious truffles in the world! I'M AN ADDICT! Wanna be my friend? some truffles and you'll be on my inheritance for sure! And not only that. Also she sold me her old tablet! I'm having so much fun learning how to draw decently on PhotoShop with it! She also says it will help me very much with all my scanlations projects, which I'll highly appreciate, since I'll be back on college on March 7th *cries*

ffpanda
. You can send greetings to a friend for Valentine Day and only s/he will be able to see them on Feb 14th. I'll be out of the town (in beach, yet again *whee*) and be back on Feb 14th no less. Take care everyone!

My granpa has been living with us since two and a half years. It was a weird experienced because I was never really close to my other granparents, as I saw them dying and feeling worst for my parents than for my granparents. My last granma had Alzheimer and for me it was a blessing when she died because she was less than a rag doll with almost no more life in her. Then this man, almost an stranger (I only knew him as my mom's father) came to live with us and we became friends and close.

Today this former stranger had the results of a medical exam. Something is wrong with is lungs. We don't know what, he needs to do another exam, but it might be cancer. Lung Cancer in my granpa. I'm trying to be positive, keeping up the positive attitude to cheer him up. I never really cared about my granparents dying until today. I'm just hoping the scanner will tell us good news. And god, all this stuff is making such a mess in my tummy ;o; I'm too young to have ulcers, right?!
